1.title: Commissioning Joshua
1.keyEvent: God commissions Joshua to lead Israel

2.title: Rahab and Spies
2.keyEvent: Rahab hides spies and makes a covenant

3.title: Crossing Jordan
3.keyEvent: Israel crosses the Jordan River miraculously

4.title: Memorial Stones
4.keyEvent: Twelve stones set as a memorial at Jordan

5.title: Circumcision and Passover
5.keyEvent: Israelites circumcised and celebrate first Passover

6.title: Fall of Jericho
6.keyEvent: Walls of Jericho fall after marching around

8.title: Ai Defeated
8.keyEvent: Israel conquers Ai with an ambush

9.title: Gibeonite Deception
9.keyEvent: Gibeonites deceive Israel into making a treaty

10.title: Southern Campaign
10.keyEvent: Joshua defeats southern kings and stops the sun

11.title: Northern Campaign
11.keyEvent: Joshua conquers northern kings and their cities

12.title: List of Conquered Kings
12.keyEvent: Summary of defeated kings east and west Jordan

13.title: Remaining Land to Conquer
13.keyEvent: God instructs Joshua on remaining lands to take

14.title: Caleb's Inheritance
14.keyEvent: Caleb claims Hebron as his inheritance

15.title: Judah's Territory
15.keyEvent: Boundaries and cities of Judah's inheritance detailed

17.title: Manasseh's Territory
17.keyEvent: Land allotment for Manasseh and daughters' request

18.title: Remaining Land Divided
18.keyEvent: Remaining seven tribes receive their land allotments

19.title: Remaining Tribal Territories
19.keyEvent: Land allotments for Simeon, Zebulun, Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, Dan

20.title: Cities of Refuge
20.keyEvent: Establishment of cities of refuge for manslayers

22.title: Eastern Tribes Return
22.keyEvent: Eastern tribes build altar causing misunderstanding

23.title: Joshua's Farewell
23.keyEvent: Joshua exhorts Israel to remain faithful to God

24.title: Covenant Renewal
24.keyEvent: Israel renews covenant at Shechem with Joshua
